intro: Manettia bicolor, commonly known as the two-colored manettia, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Central and South America, where it typically grows in humid, shaded environments. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves and small, clustered white or yellowish flowers. It produces small, round berries that are usually green when immature and turn red when ripe. Manettia bicolor is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and unique floral display.
